s.label: Beam pattern settings
s.desc: These settings are used only when running beam pattern simulations.

s.label: All stations
s.desc: If set, produce beams for all stations in the telescope model; otherwise, for selected stations.

s.label: Station ID(s)
s.desc: The zero-based station ID number(s) to select from the telescope model when generating beam pattern(s). More than one station ID is specified using a CSV list.

s.label: Coordinate frame
s.desc: Specification of the coordinate frame in which to evaluate the beam pattern. Horizon-based beam patterns will cover the entire sky.

s.label: Coordinate (grid) type
s.desc:
Specification of coordinates at which to evaluate the beam pattern.
Beam image: Tangent plane image, centred on the phase centre direction.
Sky model: Evaluate beam only at the supplied coordinates.

s.label: Beam image
s.desc: Image of the beam, centred on the phase centre.

s.label: Specify cellsize
s.desc: If set, specify cellsize; otherwise, specify field of view.

s.label: Image dimensions [pixels]
s.desc:
Image dimensions. If a single value is specified, the image is assumed to have the same number of pixels along each dimension.
Example:
A value of '256' results in a square image of size 256 by 256 pixels.
A value of '256,128' results in an image of 256 by 128 pixels, with 256 pixels along the Right Ascension direction.

s.label: Field of view [deg]
s.desc:
Field of view (FOV) in degrees (max 180.0). If a single value is specified, the image is assumed to have the same FOV along each dimension.
Example:
A value of '2.0' results in an image with a FOV of 2.0 degrees in each dimension.
A value of '2.0,1.0' results in an image with a FOV of 2.0 degrees in Right Ascension, and 1.0 degrees in Declination.

s.label: Cellsize [arcsec]
s.desc: The cell (pixel) size in arcseconds.

s.label: Input file
s.desc: Path to an input sky model file.

s.label: Output root path name
s.desc: Root path name of the generated data file. Appropriate suffixes and extensions will be added to this, based on the settings below.

s.label: Separate time and channel
s.desc: Output files without performing any averaging over the time or channel dimensions.

s.label: Average time and channel
s.desc: Output files after averaging over both the time and channel dimensions.

s.label: Average single axis
s.desc: Output files after averaging over the selected dimension.

s.label: Raw (complex) pattern
s.desc: If true, save the raw complex pattern in text files.

s.label: Amplitude pattern
s.desc: If true, save each amplitude (voltage) pattern in text files. This is given by the square root of the sum of the squares of the real and imaginary values.

s.label: Phase pattern
s.desc: If true, save each phase pattern in text files.

s.label: Auto-correlation power pattern
s.desc: If true, save each total intensity (auto-correlation) beam in text files.

s.label: Amplitude pattern
s.desc: If true, save each amplitude (voltage) pattern in FITS image files. This is given by the square root of the sum of the squares of the real and imaginary values.

s.label: Phase pattern
s.desc: If true, save each phase pattern in FITS image files.

s.label: Auto-correlation power pattern
s.desc: If true, save each total intensity (auto-correlation) beam in FITS image files.

s.label: Auto-correlation phase power pattern
s.desc: If true, save the phase of each total intensity (auto-correlation) beam in FITS image files.

s.label: Auto-correlation power pattern (real)
s.desc: If true, save the real part of each total intensity (auto-correlation) beam in FITS image files.

s.label: Auto-correlation power pattern (imag)
s.desc: If true, save the imaginary part of each total intensity (auto-correlation) beam in FITS image files.

s.label: Cross-correlation raw power pattern
s.desc: If true, save the average cross-power beam raw response from all specified stations as a text file.

s.label: Cross-correlation amplitude power pattern
s.desc: If true, save the average cross-power beam amplitude response from all specified stations as text files.

s.label: Cross-correlation phase power pattern
s.desc: If true, save the average cross-power beam phase response from all specified stations as text files.

s.label: Cross-correlation amplitude power pattern
s.desc: If true, save the average cross-power beam amplitude response from all specified stations in FITS image files.

s.label: Cross-correlation phase power pattern
s.desc: If true, save the average cross-power beam phase response from all specified stations in FITS image files.

s.label: Cross-correlation power pattern (real)
s.desc: If true, save the real part of the average cross-power beam response from all specified stations in FITS image files.

s.label: Cross-correlation power pattern (imag)
s.desc: If true, save the imaginary part of the average cross-power beam response from all specified stations in FITS image files.

s.label: Use a Stokes I test source
s.desc: Use a Stokes I test source.

s.label: Use a custom test source
s.desc: Use a custom test source.

s.label: Custom Stokes I value
s.desc: Stokes I value for the test source.

s.label: Custom Stokes Q value
s.desc: Stokes Q value for the test source.

s.label: Custom Stokes U value
s.desc: Stokes U value for the test source.

s.label: Custom Stokes V value
s.desc: Stokes V value for the test source.
